summary: The concept of "pilot school," categorized under education in EU legal and regulatory frameworks, serves as a redirect to "new educational methods." Pilot schools are experimental institutions that implement innovative pedagogical approaches, aiming to enhance educational outcomes through the adoption of novel techniques. These schools often participate in EU-funded projects designed to evaluate and disseminate effective educational practices across member states. By fostering collaboration and knowledge exchange, pilot schools contribute to the broader objective of improving education quality and accessibility within the EU, aligning with regulatory initiatives that promote lifelong learning and educational innovation.
